tasks.description: Set up the basic project structure, including directories for each domain, the core architecture, data, and models.
Install all common dependencies for the project, such as PyTorch, Hugging Face Transformers, and other libraries mentioned in the architecture documents.

Implement the five core architectural layers: Ingress & Sanitizer, Foresight Agent (Planner-Critic), Orchestrator, Execution & Review Loop, and Response Aggregator. These will be generic implementations that can be extended by each domain.

Create a data synthesis pipeline that can download datasets from Hugging Face and transform them into the ReAct-style training examples described in the documents. This pipeline should be configurable for each domain's specific datasets.
Implement the specific agents, tools, and databases for the Tanuki-History domain, as outlined in tanuki-history-architecture.md.
Implement the specific agents, tools, and databases for the Tanuki-Literature domain, as outlined in tanuki-literature-architecture.md.
Implement the specific agents, tools, and databases for the Tanuki-Programmer domain, as outlined in tanuki-programmer-architecture.md.
Implement the specific agents, tools, and databases for the Tanuki-STEM domain, as outlined in tanuki-stem-architecture.md.
Implement the training pipeline, including logic for foundation training and teacher-guided refinement. This will involve QLoRA fine-tuning and process-oriented reward mechanisms.
Download the specified base models (Gemma-2B-It, Mistral-3B, Phi-3-mini-4K-Instruct) from Hugging Face.

Investigate and provide instructions for programmatically renting an RTX 4090 GPU for a 72-hour period. This may involve using a cloud provider's API. The user will need to execute these instructions manually.

Package the final application, including the trained models and all necessary code, into a runnable format. Provide clear instructions on how to start the application and interact with the different Tanuki domains.

built_in_tools.description: Calls a smarter model to apply the last edit to the specified file.

built_in_tools.description: Looks up a pull request (or issue) by number or a commit by git ref from the current repository or a specified repository.

built_in_tools.description: Fetch a GitHub issue by its number from the current repository or a specified repository.

built_in_tools.description: Creates a Mermaid diagram that will be rendered in the chat UI.
